column5: out playing after a day searching for bass,I wasent there but could only imagine he said it sounded like a bomb going off
That wouldn't have happened on a rivited fiberglass boat! Is your buddy okay? -Brian
sore arm Brian he went in to the windshield got very lucky it dident hook and flip,there was no blisters on the hull or anything that would suggest such damage prior to it tearing itself apart
Thanks for the pic.  It looks interesting.  Looks like a two or three piece boat.

I can only assume from the age of the trailer that the boat itself was quite old? Do you know how old it was?  Hydrostreams take a real pounding riding on the chine all of the time. It looks to me like a stress crack from age. Given where it is, the boat is likely dumpster material now. What a bummer.
the # on the hull says 83 so 1983 , looked it over and de rigged it today theres no saving this one too bad rare ole stream
CRAP!!!!! Thank god hes ok, thats the main thing. WOW!!!!!!!!!!
Must've slammed a deadhead with the lower-unit?
Wow!  At least your friend was ok.
Classifieds, small leak, javex bailor should take care of water seepage  $1,500.00 or best offer  LOL
